intro: Armeriastrum erinaceum, commonly known as the hairy armeria, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its compact growth habit and ornamental value make it a popular choice for drought-tolerant landscaping.
